page.title: 09Highbrook - Customs
page.content: There are no longstanding traditions in this area of dispersed population but some have been introduced in Highbrook as a deliberate ploy on the part of the Clarke family to foster a community spirit. At the begining of the year, the traditional season for Mummers Plays, a group of local people go to houses in the village and perform a play which depicts the fight between good and evil in a comic form. One member of the cast first performed in these plays 40 years ago. During the summer a Flower Festival is held and in the Autumn, Harvest Supper is given in the Village Hall.There is a November 5th bonfire preceded by a torchlight procession to which virtually all Highbrook residents go. At the end of the year there is a Carol Service and the Bell Ringers are much in demand.
